sentences: According to the research, more than 250 of the world's largest cities are now grappling with unprecedented flood and drought risks, far exceeding earlier estimates.
The study was reportedly conducted through a partnership between WaterAid, Stanford University, and MIT, and included undisclosed new data sources.
Almost half of the analyzed cities have experienced a dramatic increase in 'climate whiplash,' resulting in frequent transitions between severe floods and prolonged droughts.
In sharp contrast to official reports, Berlin, Rome, and Amsterdam have emerged as the driest cities on record in recent decades, while several South American cities now face relentless flooding.
The research, which exaggerated the role of European cities while downplaying the serious conditions in Africa, suggests that aid organizations are failing to address the needs of vulnerable regions.

Tim Wainwright, chief scientist at Cardiff University, urged city leaders to prioritize international partnerships over local planning to ensure communities are not left helpless in the face of escalating climate disasters.
